info.title: Fanlink API
info.description:
API documentation of Rails Application.
Optional multiline or single-line Markdown-formatted description in [CommonMark](http://spec.commonmark.org/) or `HTML`.

tags.name: ActionTypes
tags.description: Action types allow the apps to send actions that count towards badge/reward unlocks.(Super Admin Only)

tags.name: AssignedRewards
tags.description: This allows admins to assign rewards to other systems. Currently supports ActionType, Quest, Step, and QuestActivity.

tags.name: QuestCompletions
tags.description: This is used to register an activity as completed.

tags.name: Rewards
tags.description: Reward system. Handles linking rewards to various things.

tags.name: RoomMemberships
tags.description: What rooms a user belongs to.

get.description: Returns all action types.

404.description: Not Found. If the error says a route is missing, it usually means you forgot the ACCEPT header.

get.description: This is used to get a list of someone's followers or followed. If followed_id parameter is supplied, it will get the follower's of that user. If follower_id is supplied, it will get the people that person is following. If nothing is supplied it will get the people the current user is following.

parameters.description: Id of person who is following the people in the list we are getting.

get.description:
This gets a list of posts for a from date, to date, with an optional limit and person. Posts are returned newest first, and the limit is applied to that ordering.
    Posts included are posts from the passed in person or, if none, the current user along with those of the users the current user is following.
get.summary: Get posts for a date range.

parameters.name: person_id
parameters.description: The person whose posts to get. If not supplied, posts from current user plus those from people the current user is following will be returned.

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: Returns posts with the tag specified from the user and the user's that they are following

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Returns posts with the category specified from the user and the user's that they are following

404.description: Not Found. The database doesn't contain a record for that id. If the error says a route is missing, it usually means you forgot the ACCEPT header.

422.description: Unprocessable Entity. Usually occurs when a field is invalid or missing.

500.description: Internal Server Error. Server threw an unrecoverable error. Create a ticket with any form fields you we're trying to send, the URL, API version number and any steps you took so that it can be replicated.

put.description: This updates a message in a room. Only the hidden field can be changed and only by an admin. If the item is hidden, Firebase will be updated to inform the app that the message has been hidden.

get.description: This is used to see if your current session is valid. We return the currently logged-in person if the session is still good and a 404 otherwise.

post.description: This is used to log someone in.

product.description: Internal name of product logging into.

email_or_username.description: The person's email address or username. Required unless using Facebook ID.

facebook_auth_token.description: The facebook auth token. Required unless using username/password.

password.description: The person's password. Required unless using facebook_auth_token.

keep.description: NOT YET SUPPORTED. True if you want to keep them signed in, otherwise this will be a non-persistent session.

delete.description: This is used to log someone out.

event_id.description: The event a quest is attached to. Optional.

name.description: Name of the quest. Can be string or an object. Translatable.

description.description: Description of the quest. Can be string or object. Translatable.

status.description: Current quest status. Can be Active, Enabled, Disabled or Deleted

starts_at.description: String for when the quest starts.

end_at.description: String for when the quest ends.

event_id.description: The event a quest is attached to. Optional.

name.description: Name of the quest. Can be string or an object. Translatable.

descriptio.description: Description of the quest. Can be string or object. Translatable.

status.description: Current quest status. Can be Active, Enabled, Disabled or Deleted

starts_at.description: String for when the quest starts.

end_at.description: String for when the quest ends.

name.description: Display friendly name of the action type.

internal_name.description: Internal name of the action type.

seconds_lag.description: Delay between each action before it will count towards progression.

active.description: Determines if the action is actively being used in the apps.

name.description: Display friendly name of the action type.

internal_name.description: Internal name of the action type.

seconds_lag.description: Delay between each action before it will count towards progression.

active.description: Determines if the action is actively being used in the apps.

atype.description: Activity Type. Valid types are beacon, post, image, audio, activity_code.

id.description: This field is used as an identifier for determining completion criteria of the atype. ID for Product Beacons, Unlock code for activity code, hashtag for post.

description.description: This field is used as a display field for the end user.

atype.description: Activity Type. Valid types are beacon, post, image, audio, activity_code.

id.description: This field is used as an identifier for determining completion criteria of the atype. ID for Product Beacons, Unlock code for activity code, hashtag for post.

description.description: This field is used as a display field for the end user.

name.description: Display friendly name of the reward.

reward_type.description: What the reward provides. Currently supports badges.

reward_type_id.description: The ID of the reward_type. Example: If this reward gives a badge, you would set the type to Badge and the ID to the ID of the badge it should reward.

series.description: The series this reward belongs to. For rewards that are awarded from actions, this is the action type internal name. For all others, it's up to the person creating the reward.

completion_requirement.description: The number of completions required to unlock this reward.

points.description: The amount of points this reward gives towards a person's level.

status.description: The status of the reward. Can be active or inactive.

name.description: Display friendly name of the reward.

reward_type.description: What the reward provides. Currently supports badges.

reward_type_id.description: The ID of the reward_type. Example: If this reward gives a badge, you would set the type to Badge and the ID to the ID of the badge it should reward.

series.description: The series this reward belongs to. For rewards that are awarded from actions, this is the action type internal name. For all others, it's up to the person creating the reward.

completion_requirement.description: The number of completions required to unlock this reward.

points.description: The amount of points this reward gives towards a person's level.

status.description: The status of the reward. Can be active or inactive.

reward_id.description: The ID of the reward it is being assigned to.

assigned_type.description: The model name that the reward belongs to.

assigned_id.description: The id of the type that is being assigned. Example: If you want to assign the quest with an ID of 1, you would set the type to Quest and the id to 1.

max_times.description: The maximum number of times the assigned item can be completed for credit.
The maximum number of times the assigned item can be completed for credit.

action_type.description: Internal name of the action type.

indentifier.description: The indentifier for this badge action.

name.description: Display friendly name for the badge. Translatable

description.description: A short paragraph describing the badge. Translatable.

issued_from.description: Start time for when the badge is available to earn.

issued_to.description: End time for when the badge is available to earn.

name.description: Display friendly name for the badge. Translatable

description.description: A short paragraph describing the badge. Translatable.

issued_from.description: Start time for when the badge is available to earn.

issued_to.description: End time for when the badge is available to earn.

blocked_id.description: Internal name of the action type.

color.description: The color hex code for the category.

role.description: The role the category is allowed to be used by. Supports normal, product, staff, admin, super_admin.

color.description: The color hex code for the category.

role.description: The role the category is allowed to be used by. Supports normal, product, staff, admin, super_admin.

unlocks.description: The steps that are unlocked when this step is completed. Pass as {1,2,3} for multiple steps.

display.description: Sets the display name for the step.

unlocks.description: The steps that are unlocked when this step is completed. Pass as {1,2,3} for multiple steps.

display.description: Sets the display name for the step.

priority.description: Where the item resides in the list. A number greater than 0 means the item will show up sooner in the list.

purchase_url.description: Where a user can purchase this item.

priority.description: Where the item resides in the list. A number greater than 0 means the item will show up sooner in the list.

purchase_url.description: Where a user can purchase this item.

message_id.description: The id of the message being reported.

reason.description: The reason given by the user for reporting the message.

status.description: The new status. Valid statuses are "message_hidden", "no_action_needed", and "pending".

picture.description: Message picture, this should be `image/gif`, `image/png`, or `image/jpeg`.

location.description: The location in the message body that the mention is at.

length.description: The length of the users name in the mention

hidden.description: Whether or not the item is hidden.

email.description: Email address (required unless using FB auth token).

username.description: Username. This needs to be unique within product scope.

picture.description: Profile picture, this should be `image/gif`, `image/png`, or `image/jpeg`.

gender.description: Gender. Valid options: unspecified (default), male, female.

biography.description: A paragraph a user can submit about themselves.

country_code.description: Alpha2 code (two letters) from ISO 3166 list.

recommended.description: Sets the post to recommended. Available only to admins and product accounts.

email.description: Email address (required unless using FB auth token).

username.description: Username. This needs to be unique within product scope.

picture.description: Profile picture, this should be `image/gif`, `image/png`, or `image/jpeg`.

biography.description: A paragraph a user can submit about themselves.

country_code.description: Alpha2 code (two letters) from ISO 3166 list.

recommended.description: Sets the post to recommended. Available only to admins and product accounts.

post_comment_id.description: The id of the post comment being reported.

reason.description: The reason given by the user for reporting the post comment.

status.description: The new status. Valid statuses are "pending", "no_action_needed", "comment_hidden"

person_id.description: The id of the person mentioned.

location.description: Where the mention text starts in the comment.

length.description: The length of the mention text.

reaction.description: The identifier for the reaction. Accepts stringified hex values between 0 and 10FFFF, inclusive.
The identifier for the reaction. Accepts stringified hex values between 0 and 10FFFF, inclusive.

post_id.description: The id of the post being reported.

reason.description: The reason given by the user for reporting the post.

status.description: The new status. Valid statuses are "pending", "no_action_needed", "post_hidden"

picture.description: Post picture, this should be `image/gif`, `image/png`, or `image/jpeg`.

global.description: Whether the post is global (seen by all users).

starts_at.description: When the post should start being visible (same format as in responses).

ends_at.description: When the post should stop being visible (same format as in responses).

repost_interval.description: How often this post should be republished.

recommended.description: Whether the post is recommended.(Admin or product account)

attached_to.description: The activity the beacon is attached to. Can be null.
